intro: Mariscus acicularis, commonly known as the needleleaf mariscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying xerophytic plants.
